title: When a speaker briefly interrupts their own dialogue, then resumes in the same paragraph, how do you punctuate the interruption? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d have to verify but I believe… If making a direct quote, just space it with commas. Use ellipses to take out irrelevant words to promote clarity. If it’s fictional, you can do what you want. If you must have the speaker meander, in order to show character traits, I recommend the commas. However, if it’s straight communication/exposition through dialogue, I would sincerely consider restructuring the conversation for clarity. If it’s fictional, and the narrator is speaking direct to the reader, once again consider restructure, or use parentheses if you must.
